markdownRemark.html:
HackerOne integrates with many issue tracking tools. The integration ensures that the HackerOne platform fits into your existing security workflow with minimal friction. Integrating with one of these services will enable you to push report submissions into your preferred systems. You can set up multiple issue tracker integrations as well as a Slack integration.

HackerOne currently supports these integrations:

Note: An asterisk(*) indicates the integration is available for Enterprise customers only.

Assembla
AWS Security Hub*
Azure DevOps*
Brinqa Integration
Bugzilla
ClickUp
Cortex XSOAR
Freshdesk
GitHub
GitLab
HackEDU
IBM QRadar SOAR
Jira
JupiterOne
Kenna Security
Linear
MantisBT
Microsoft Teams*
OTRS
PagerDuty*
Phabricator
PlexTrac
Redmine
SafeBase
ServiceNow*
Security Scorecard
Slack
Splunk*
Sumo Logic*
Trac
Vulcan
Zendesk
ArmorCode

Don't see your issue tracker listed here? Let us know to get that added for you.

Using Multiple Integrations

You can set up multiple integrations with HackerOne. To select which issue tracker you want to escalate the HackerOne report to:

  1. Change the action picker to Change state > Triaged in your report on HackerOne.
  2. Click Add reference to issue tracker.

  1. Select the issue tracker you want to escalate the report to.

  1. Click Generate escalation. You'll be taken to your integration account where the report will be pre-populated.
  2. Submit the issue to create the report in your integrated issue tracker.
  3. Copy the report issue number in your issue tracker and paste it in the Ref ID field in HackerOne.
  4. Click Create to create a direct reference link to the issue in your integrated issue tracker.
